TopicTitle: What will you do first in 1.0?

Articles.Content: With all the new features, I'm afraid of mod breaking, so I'm just going to start a new save using only stock until my mod parts update.

> 
> First thing I will do is fix all of my mods.
> Pardon me while I go cry in a corner for a bit....

I feel sorry for you and NathanKell....
I thought and think about the best options. First thing could be to take a look at the stock hard mode career.
I will attempt to improve my Saturn V replica with the new fairing system, reducing part count and making it even more accessible/useful.

> 
> First thing I will do is fix all of my mods.
> Pardon me while I go cry in a corner for a bit....

Thank you for making awesome things!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> It's going to be odd to not need FAR installed.

No offense to Ferram, but I hope you are right.
I'll be updating my mods. Then a new career.
new career and maybe some complaining about broken stuff ;p
Read the forums to know how 1.0 is while waiting for all the mods to update. I.e. the same thing I've always done for the past few updates.

I will build an aeroshell for my Constellation landers massively reducing the part count! It cannot come soon enough.

 After that I will test my Eagle SSTO and other craft for compatibility with the new aero model.

Try out and repair/upgrade/redesign all of my spaceplanes, lifters and shuttles, ultimately spending 20+ hours meddling around in the VAB and SPH...

...so basically, the usual.

First I will see if it is still possible to launch ridiculously designed ships such as saucers. Then I'll learn how to design and fly a good spaceplane or six.

But then, as OP mentioned, I will start a serious career. THis will be my main focus, as I haven't played career mode in several months.

Play a game with my kerbals with the re-entry heat, having each of them in a different command pod of some sort, and seeing who is the last one alive.

Winner takes a book of matches.

re -learning how to fly to space, using the rendezvous tutorial to finally master docking in kerbin orbit (have only docked in mun orbit), learn how to design proper space planes and fly them, go mining on the Mun (since I think no inclination+closer distance>lower gravity), go to duna, Jool, etc. (finally!), get KER, then get a crap ton of parts mods, maybe (MAYBE) start modding.

Step 1: Land on the Mun and return safely, sandbox, completely stock. 

Step 2: Mod the hell out of it and play either science or career.

Crash, probably, because something fundamental will be different.

<(o.o)<

>(o.o)>

What? SOMEbody had to say it!

I'll restart career again, and again on hard mode. I'm going to grind enough to afford a manned mission to the Joolian moons, as I've only sent probes there up to now...

Depending on how realistic the aero overhaul will be, I'm also considering installing FAR again, as well as KIDS to keep the game balanced (given both mods will be available for 1.0).
I *wont* restart my career and will try out planes. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Based on past experience, ignore it and keep playing .90 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

But I think I will give Squad a week to issue a point update if they need to, then go and look to see if the bugs that infuriate me in .90 have been fixed. If they haven't I'm going to be Not Very Impressed.
Test if the new aero model is anything like FAR and decide whether i should continue using FAR or not.

> 
> colonizing Laythe. Com sats, couple space stations for utility and tourism, aircraft, and ground stations complete with self sufficient resource mining.

First, start writing my story "Survival". It's gonna be good!

Second, send my last Laythe ship.

Laythe is my KSP everything, but I have so many other things to focus on. 

It'll be made of LOW (Laythe One Way) 01 Lina and LOW 02 Paul.

I'll also make a funny but also serious video on the trip. 

I'll be packing tons.

Literally, I'm guessing 1,000-2,000 tons on LOW 1 and 2 combined.

Can't wait!

1. Sit down to learn how to design a launch vehicle, starting with the dV and TWR requirements.
2. Laugh at the inevitability of tens of threads from hundreds of people whining that their old designs don't work any more.
3. Shake head sadly at the thousands of others that have no idea what's going on and won't read a single thing to find out.
4. Start writing some proper tutorials.

Launch a rocket to 5,000 meters.

Probably.

What I'll do first is download the game. Then I'll:

- Try out the new systems and make a critical review (hoping I don't have to be *too* critical).
- Check out the memory management and see what bugs were fixed, and whether the ocean is still an ocean of lag (hopefully I won't be laughing at the players on Win32 griping about memory-related crashes).
- Watch people who used to spaceplane well fail horribly under the new systems (and gripe about the nerfs/realism improvements).
- If I can figure out Blender's video editing I'll make a video of the new stock systems.
- Wait for all the mods I use to update and probably make some contributions to them.
- Restart my old save in order to get female Kerbals.
- Recreate my Kerbal renaming mod to handle the new Kerbals.
Rebuild my MPCV ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
